snippet: Secretary General Ban Ki-moon said he removed a Saudi-led coalition that is bombing Yemen from a list of children’s rights violators after the Saudis threatened to withhold funding.
abstract: United Nations Sec Gen Ban Ki-moon admits prospect of losing funding for humanitarian aid led him to strike Saudi-led military coalition in Yemen from list of forces suspected of attacking children; atypically forthright confession is aimed at exposing degree of pressure nations exert on UN heads to protect their unique interests.
lead_paragraph: Secretary General Ban Ki-moon said he removed a Saudi-led coalition that is bombing Yemen from a list of children’s rights violators after the Saudis threatened to withhold funding.

headline.main: United Nations Chief Exposes Limits to His Authority by Citing Saudi Threat
headline.print_headline: U.N. Leader Says He Bowed to Threat From Saudis on Rights Violations

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
